N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 425.2 - Provision of day services

State Regulations
(a) No local social services official or the

Division for Youth shall contract for a day services program unless the
facility has first received an operating or provisional permit issued by the
department. (b) A local social
services official may provide or purchase day services for a child and his
family when it has been determined by the social services official that such
services would accomplish one or more of the following objectives: (1)
avert a risk of serious impairment or
disruption of a family unit which would result in the placement of a child
outside his home; (2)
enable a
child who has been placed in a child-caring institution or other group facility
to be placed in a foster care setting more closely oriented to the community or
family life; or
(3)
enable a child
who has been placed in foster care to return to his family at an earlier time
than would otherwise be possible. (c) Services may not be provided for more
than one year without prior approval of the department. Notes
